TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi Paragraph extends System.Windows.Documents.Block

Docs.summary: A block-level flow content element used to group content into a paragraph.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Paragraph enforces a strong content model for child content. See [TextElement Content Model Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information about the Paragraph content model.
In addition to plain text, a Paragraph element can host other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> elements. Valid child elements include:
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Bold>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Figure>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Floater>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Italic>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LineBreak>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Underline>
See [Flow Document Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information on what this object can contain and what can contain it.

Docs.summary: Gets an containing the top-level elements that comprise the contents of the .
Docs.value:
An containing the elements that comprise the contents of the .
This property has no default value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph> element.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text of the paragraph may be broken by a page break or column break.
Docs.value: to prevent the text of the paragraph from being broken; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a break may occur between this paragraph and the next paragraph.
Docs.value: to prevent a break from occurring between this paragraph and the next paragraph; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum number of lines that can be left before the break when a is broken by a page break or column break.
Docs.value:
An integer specifying the minimum number of lines that can be left before the break when a is broken by a page break or column break. A value of 0 indicates no minimum.
The default value is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum number of lines that can be placed after the break when a is broken by a page break or column break.
Docs.value:
An integer specifying the minimum number of lines that can be placed after the break when a is broken by a page break or column break. A value of 0 indicates no minimum.
The default value is 0.

.method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeInlines(class System.Windows.Markup.XamlDesignerSerializationManager manager) cil managed

Docs.param: A serialization service manager object for this object.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.Inlines%2A> property should be persisted.
Docs.returns: if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.Inlines%2A> property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a that contains text decorations to apply to this element.
Docs.value: A collection that contains text decorations to apply to this element. A value of means no text decorations will be applied. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A object is a visual ornamentation you can add to text. There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline. For more information about text decorations, see [How to: Create a Text Decoration](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|| ## Examples The following example shows how to set the TextDecorations property of a . [!code-xml[InlineSnippets#_Paragraph_TextDecXAML](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/InlineSnippets/Window1.xaml#_paragraph_textdecxaml)] [!code-cs[InlineSnippets#_Paragraph_TextDec](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/InlineSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_paragraph_textdec)] [!code-vb[InlineSnippets#_Paragraph_TextDec](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/inlinesnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_paragraph_textdec)] The following figure shows how this example renders. ![Screenshot: Text with default strikethrough effect](~/add/media/inline-textdec-strike.png "Screenshot: Text with default strikethrough effect") The following figures show how the **Overline**, **Baseline**, and **Underline** decorations render, respectively. ![Screenshot: Overline TextDecorator](~/add/media/inline-textdec-over.png "Screenshot: Overline TextDecorator") ![Screenshot: Default baseline effect on text](~/add/media/inline-textdec-base.png "Screenshot: Default baseline effect on text") ![Screenshot: Text with default underline effect](~/add/media/inline-textdec-under.png "Screenshot: Text with default underline effect")

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty TextDecorationsProperty

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how far to indent the first line of a .
Docs.value: A double value specifying the amount to indent the first line of the paragraph, in device independent pixels. The default value is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* A string representation of a value equal to or greater than 0.0 but smaller than . An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels. Strings need not explicitly include decimal points. *qualifiedDouble* A `double` value as described above, (except `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`. `px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty TextIndentProperty
